questions.question: 1. Which of the following gates gives 1 as the output only when its inputs are 0 only?

explanations.a: Incorrect. The NAND gate does not give an output of 1 only when both inputs are 0; it gives 1 for other input combinations as well.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The XOR gate gives 1 when inputs are different, not only when both are 0.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The XNOR gate gives 1 when both inputs are the same, not only when both are 0.
explanations.d: Correct. The NOR gate gives 1 only when both inputs are 0; for all other cases, the output is 0.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following logic gates are functionally complete?

explanations.a: Incorrect. The OR gate alone is not functionally complete because it cannot implement the NOT operation.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The XOR gate alone is not functionally complete because it cannot implement the NOT operation.
explanations.c: Correct. The NAND gate is functionally complete and can be used to construct any other gate.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The AND gate alone is not functionally complete because it cannot implement NOT or OR operations.

questions.question: 3. An inverter can be realized as?

explanations.a: Incorrect. i and iii alone cannot realize all inverter functions.
explanations.b: Incorrect. ii and iv alone cannot realize all inverter functions.
explanations.c: Correct. All options shown can be used to realize an inverter.
explanations.d: Incorrect. iii and iv alone cannot realize all inverter functions.

questions.question: 4. In CMOS NAND gate the NMOS are in

explanations.a: Correct. In a CMOS NAND gate, the NMOS transistors are connected in series in the pull-down network.
explanations.b: Incorrect. In a CMOS NAND gate, the NMOS transistors are not connected in parallel; PMOS transistors are parallel in the pull-up network.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The connection of NMOS transistors is not random; it follows a specific design for logic functionality.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The NMOS connection is specifically series, not either parallel or series.

questions.question: 5. Which of the following are universal gates?

explanations.a: Incorrect. While NAND is a universal gate, the question asks for all universal gates, not just NAND.
explanations.b: Incorrect. While NOR is a universal gate, the question asks for all universal gates, not just NOR.
explanations.c: Incorrect. OR gate is not a universal gate; it cannot implement all logical functions.
explanations.d: Correct. Both NAND and NOR gates are universal gates and can implement any logical function.
